results.title: Chilean hacienda: a traditional farm estate
results.creator_credit: Hollywood Film Enterprises and Clifford J. Kamen
results.brief_description: A relatively small part of Chile is suitable for farming but in this part are large farm estates, many owned by the descendants of the Spaniards who originally settled there. Employing as many as 1,000 employees, each hacienda will have its own shopping centre, school, and hospital. The employees give some of their time in payment for housing etc and also receive wages. The products are wheat, fruit, cattle, potatoes, and similar farm products. Amusements include dancing and rodeos. The haciendas are the core of the farming system of an agricultural nation.

results.title: Chile: hasta cuando?(Captioned)
results.brief_description: An account of the political unrest in Chile, 12 years after the murder of Allende and the installation of military dictatorship under General Pinochet. This powerful documentary is also about the struggle of the people of Chile. Under the dictatorship of Pinochet some 50,000 Chileans were detained, many are missing believed dead.

results.title: Children, Television and Violence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Monday Conference”.
Dr. William Belsen, who has carried out extensive research on children, television and violence, talks with a Monday Conference audience comprising researchers, industry people, teachers and parents. Many interesting areas are touched upon including the difficulty of establishing casual links between television violence and real violence carried out by children, how parents can identify which programs are likely to be “casually” violent, and the possible cathartic effect of television violence

results.title: Children who draw pictures (TEFC)
results.brief_description: With colour sequences. A study of artistic activities of first grade children in a Tokyo primary school. Through the year they experiment with pencil, crayon, finger painting, oil and clay, showing development of individual observation. Shows how school and home experiences influence choice and treatment of subjects, and how feelings are communicated in creative effort.

results.title: Children waiting
results.creator_credit: Jean Wadlow, Charles Barker Films, National Playing Fields Association and Robert Giles
results.brief_description: Illustrates the need for playing facilities for children who live in cities. Shows an adventure playground at Stevenage, Kent, as an example of what can be achieved through community organization and effort. Suitable for Tertiary/Teacher education.

results.title: Children talking to writers
results.brief_description: This compilation tape contains three programmes in which children interview well-known Australian writers of children’s stories: Christobel Mattingley, Daphne Bidwell and Hugh Edwards. The writers talk about how they discipline themselves to work, and describe the sources of inspiration for their writing.

results.title: Children on the fringe
results.creator_credit: University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre and George Pashuk
results.brief_description: Shows innovatory language stimulation techniques employed in a rural preschool designed for culturally disadvantaged part-Aboriginal and white children. Rationale, teaching strategies, evaluation and outcome are discussed. The relevance of the experiment for Australian preschool education is considered.
results.creator_credit_for_label: University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre and George Pashuk
